meanings.definition: Close and open one eye quickly as a signal or hint.
meanings.sent1: She would wink at her friend to show they should leave.
meanings.sent2: He likes to wink when he's joking around.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat would wink at the mouse before pouncing.
meanings.sent4: The old man would wink at the children, sharing a secret smile.
meanings.sent5: The star performer would wink at the audience, inviting them into her world.

meanings.definition: A quick closing and opening of one eye as a signal or hint.
meanings.sent1: His wink told her it was time to go.
meanings.sent2: She gave him a playful wink across the room.
meanings.sent3: The wink from the teacher meant the answer was correct.
meanings.sent4: The wink of the lighthouse guided the ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The sly wink of the fox showed he had a plan in mind.
